title: What The Experts Are Saying Ahead Of Lyft's IPO
text: Ride-hailing company Lyft will see its shares trade on a public market for the first time Friday. Ahead of the much-anticipated IPO, the following is a roundup of what industry experts are saying.

title: On eve of Lyft's much-hyped debut, Warren Buffett says regular investors shouldn't buy hot IPOs
text: Amid a glut of IPOs this year, Berkshire Hathaway's CEO warns retail investors not to get carried away with the euphoria.

title: Is Lyft Worth $19 Billion?
text: Lyft has very strong revenue growth but lost almost $1 billion last year. However, when you compare its Enterprise Value to revenue valuation metric vs. various public companies it going public at $68 (or a bit above that) isn’t unreasonable.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Equipment from China’s Huawei has major security flaws, U.K. says
text: British officials accused Huawei Technologies Co. of repeatedly failing to address security flaws in its products and said the company hasn’t demonstrated a commitment to fixing them.

title: Howard Gold's No-Nonsense Investing: These investors are the big winners from Lyft and other unicorn IPOs
text: VCs, Wall Street are rushing to cash out of the hottest private companies while the getting is good, writes Howard Gold.

title: Lyft and Uber's European rivals are trying to make money before going public
text: European ride-hailing and carpooling start-ups are more focused on profitability than their U.S. counterparts.
